learning.unsupervised.methods

Class DBScan

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • learning.unsupervised.ClusteringAlg
        • learning.unsupervised.methods.DBScan
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Citable, NSFUserInterface, java.lang.Runnable, DistMatrixUserInterface

    public class DBScan
extends ClusteringAlg
implements DistMatrixUserInterface, NSFUserInterface
    This class implements the well-known density based DBScan algorithm first proposed in the following paper: Martin Ester, Hans-Peter Kriegel, JÃ¶rg Sander, Xiaowei Xu (1996). "A density-based algorithm for discovering clusters in large spatial databases with noise"

      • searchForGoodParameters

        public void searchForGoodParameters()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method searches for a good parameter configuration. This is achieved by a pre-defined threshold bias where the distances to the k-th nearest neighbor are sorted and then a certain number is discarded as noise. The borderline k-distance is then taken as a limit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMinPoints

        public int getMinPoints()
        Returns:
        Integer that is the minimal number of points a neighborhood can have not to be considered noise.

      • setMinPoints

      • expandTestCluster

        public void expandTestCluster(int index,
                     int neighbSize,
                     Cluster currCluster,
                     int clustIndex,
                     NeighborSetFinder nsfTest,
                     int[] clusterAssociations,
                     boolean[] visitedTest,
                     float epsilonNeighborhoodTest)
        Expands the cluster around the considered core test point as much as possible.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the observed test core point.
        neighbSize - Neighborhood size.
        currCluster - Current cluster.
        clustIndex - Index of the current cluster.
        nsfTest - NeighborSetFinder object on the test set.
        clusterAssociations - Cluster associations.
        visitedTest - Boolean array indicating which test points have been visited up until this point.
        epsilonNeighborhoodTest - Epsilon neighborhood diameter on the test data.

      • setDistMatrix

        public void setDistMatrix(float[][] distances)
        Description copied from interface: DistMatrixUserInterface
        Distance matrix setter.
        Specified by:
        setDistMatrix in interface DistMatrixUserInterface
        Parameters:
        distances - float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix. Each row i contains only entries for j > i, due to distances being symmetric. For compression, the zeroed lower triangular entries are not stored, so each row i contains (size - i - 1) elements. The entry in distMatrix[i][j] corresponds to the distance between data points i and i + j + 1.

      • getDistMatrix

        public float[][] getDistMatrix()
        Description copied from interface: DistMatrixUserInterface
        Distance matrix getter.
        Specified by:
        getDistMatrix in interface DistMatrixUserInterface
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix. Each row i contains only entries for j > i, due to distances being symmetric. For compression, the zeroed lower triangular entries are not stored, so each row i contains (size - i - 1) elements. The entry in distMatrix[i][j] corresponds to the distance between data points i and i + j + 1.

      • noRecalcs

        public void noRecalcs()
        Description copied from interface: NSFUserInterface
        Indicating that the object is shared and no recalculations can be done on it for synchronization purposes. An empty implementation is appropriate in methods that do not modify the NeighborSetFinder object's content.
        Specified by:
        noRecalcs in interface NSFUserInterface

      • getMinimizingClusters

        public Cluster[] getMinimizingClusters()
        Description copied from class: ClusteringAlg
        Gets the configuration that had a minimum error function, instead of returning the final one. In most methods, the two are equivalent - but this does not need to be the case in general.
        Overrides:
        getMinimizingClusters in class ClusteringAlg
        Returns:
